episode_title: How I Made $150K in 3 Weeks with Christmas Lights (After a Job Selling Toothpaste) with Anne McGinty
transcript:
﻿Nikolas Hulewsky (00:00.078)
And the reason I'm super excited to have you is not only because you have a really cool podcast, but you've talked to a bunch of different entrepreneurs over the last year. And I think you would have really good perspective for people who are listening, trying to figure out how to get into entrepreneurship or grow their business. But before we get into that piece, because I'm super excited to brainstorm with you, tell me your background.

Yeah

Nikolas Hulewsky (00:55.47)
Where was this? OK.

And from there, once I realized that I could not make enough money in this full-time job to do anything because I was struggling to save money. It took me six months to save $1,000.


I, yeah, because I was on, it was a base salary of near 30,000 and then my bonuses got me to about 50,000. But when you live in the Bay Area and you take out your health insurance and you take out your utilities and your phone bill and then you pay taxes, it really whittles down very quickly when rent is so high. So I took six months to save $1,000, was very happy and celebrated and then I quickly,

So


That property in Jackson Hole, what it was, $230,000, so $46,000 down. I sold it the next year for a 100 and, it was either a 126,000 or $156,000 profit. And that was just a good start, right? So this was 2005.
